alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Frederick; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 5:56PM EDT until March 31 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Washington County in north central Maryland... Northwestern Carroll County in north central Maryland... Northwestern Frederick County in north central Maryland... North central Jefferson County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... Northeastern Berkeley County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 555 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Martinsburg, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Hagerstown, Martinsburg, Thurmont, Emmitsburg, Shepherdstown, Municipal Stadium, Robinwood, Boonsboro, Smithsburg, Williamsport, Mount Aetna, Mount Lena, San Mar, Wolfsville, Saint James, Berkeley, Halfway, Myersville, Cavetown and Keedysville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
